Killing floor is one of the best games i have ever played.
Its great with friends or solo, been out since forever and forever will be an amazing game!

Killing Floor is a great example of a co-op multiplayer game. If you’re looking for a game where you and up to five of your friends can play and improve at together, Killing Floor is the right game for you.
For a game that started out as an Unreal Tournament 2004 mod, it’s very impressive how far Killing Floor has come, and it only looks to be getting better with Steam Workshop integration recently added. Killing Floor is well worth it!

The best game )

Decided to start recommending my favorite games on steam. This one is a great wave defense coop class based first person shooter. That 8 word genre really sums up the finer points of the game but to go a bit further it is a bunch of guys with guns shooting wave of monsters. The monsters are individually weaker but come in different varieties and great numbers.
Yes.

育成要素がある、珍しいタイプのcoopFPS。
更にヘッドショットで雑魚を倒すことが前提のようなバランス調整がされている。
ヘッドショットした時に特徴のある効果音と共に首が吹き飛ぶ、といった所に爽快感がある。
特定条件化でZED(スローモー)が発生し、そこで大量に首を飛ばすのも気持ちよい。
育成要素部分について話すと、Lv1~Lv6まであり、結構lv間のボーナスが大きい。
だからといって能力に差が生まれるかと思いきや、難易度で大体のレベル分けがされている。
その為自分にあった難易度をやれば、自ずと他の味方も似たようなレベルになる。
･･･というのが理想だったのだろうが、Lv6で低難易度に来て無双する人もそれなりにいる。
高難易度のSuicidal,Hell on Earthになると高度なPSが求められる為、それが原因だろうか。
また、Lv4~6あたりになってくるとかなり経験値が必要になる(Perkごとに決められた条件がある)為、かなりだれてくる。
賛否両論な部分はあるが、セール等でかなり安くなる為買って損はないゲームだと思う。

Средне-неплохой зомби-шутер. Есть особые заражённые, много особых заражённых! Преимущества огнестрельного оружия, если вы не берсеркер. 
Выбор ветки прокачки персонажа (скилов нет, есть пассивные бонусы от прокачанной активной ветки) Сложно выжить. Коператив по танглу настраивается.
really good game to play with ur friends
Отличный кооперативный шутер со сложностью, которая варьируется от "Как два пальца" до "Это похлеще, чем DooM на Nightmare". И да, абсолютно ничего общего с Left 4 Dead. Абсолютно.\

Excelente ambientacion, desafio, musica, sonido, personajes, armas, ZOOM EN ARMAS (por marcar una GRAN diferencia si lo comparamos con el Left 4 Dead), 8 jugadores en tu equipo y muchas cosas mas hacen este juego un Must Have si te gusta el coop.

Easily my favorite game on Steam.  Because of all the steam sales, its gotten harder to find actual decent KF players online.  The absurd amount of bad players online is my only beef with the game.  Other than that it's a well done co-op survival horror game with enought whitelisted maps and mods to keep you playing for years.

Fantastic Coop shooter. I still come back to play this title every so often even after owning it a number of years. There are tons of classes to pick from and grind away at leveling up. Lots of awesome maps/mods to play in as well, even new releases from the devs. at regular intervals usually around holidays. For the price tag its a steal.
Do it
A game everyone should have in their library!

My good friend MurkyDeath got me to get this game and I'm very pleased he did. Killing Floor is a fantastic take on a human VS A.I. wave based survival game. Very few multiplayer games make me care about a random stranger at my side but this game does that incredibly well. I want to see those teammates survive, I feel sadness when they perish and a true sense that my own chance of survival has just been drastically reduced. With that in mind this game can be a tad difficult until you get a few rounds under your belt. However, a nice (although somewhat slow) leveling system and hilariously British dialog make all those deaths and do overs a very enjoyable experience. This game goes on sale very frequently...  Spend some dosh and grab it while you can lads.  Stores closing.
<3 it

Зомби, зомби и еще раз зомби. Хорошая игра, как для игры в соло, так и для компании в скайпе. Суть игры заключается в кровавых противостояниях зомби, нужно продержаться некое количество волн, с каждой волной количесто замби возрастает и наконец, на последней волне вам предстаит сразиться с самим Патриархом. В игре можно выбрать класс, за который вы будите играть, у каждого класса есть свои навыки и плюшки. Игра имеет только мультиплеер и большего ей не надо.

Although the sequel is out killing floor 1 is still a great game. It is one of the few games that actually encourage teamwork and skill. I have rarely ever seen complete strangers pull together as quickly as a group of players in killing floor.

I also like the perk system and how it is often uncertain whether or not your team will win. It's a great coop game and fun online and occasionaly I will even play it single player. It's fun to mod to.
HeadShotが決まると最高に気持ちいいCo-op型FPS。協力は強制してはいないが、協力すればいい結果につながりやすく、楽しいのもgood。また、やればやるほどに面白さや旨味がわかるようになるスルメのようなゲーム体験をさせてくれる。これは間違いなくオススメ。

If any of you know me at all, then you know that I FUCKING HATE ZOMBIE GAMES. In general, I hate zombie related franchises from films to games to everything in between. Killing Floor changed my opinion on all of that. This game, while simple, doesn't pretend to be something its not. It doesn't juke you with a hinting at a story like Dead Island and it doesn't think that lame archetypes and uninspired level design are the keys to success like Left 4 Dead. It is simple, brutal carnage. Characters rely on one another because of the overwhelming power of the specimens, not on individual limitations. Character classes let you play the way you want, and all classes can be leveled while playing a different class entirely. Levels are hugely varied and require on the spot thinking in most situations. The graphics showcase every gruesome decapitation in detail without slowing down your framerate. It is a marvel in multiplayer gaming and I highly recommend anyone with even a fleeting interest in cooperative shooters to buy this game. I'll see you in London. But then again, so will they.

Killing floor is a fun first person survival co-op horror game that many people would enjoy. Some background on is that your a british military team sent to destroy this disease. This takes place in Europe around different parts centered around the UK. Some ups and downs of this game is the controls are natural and easy to work with. It is a great game to play with your friends. In the game it makes it easy to find the trader who is selling you weapons to survive. Also there is perks that allow people to do certain things in better ways. Also the survival asspect of it is amazing. You have to make choices to decide the fait of your team like if I weld this door will it save us from getting over run also if you go down a hallway will it trap you are save your team. Some downs of this game is it can get really repetitive at points. Also the price is a little iffey. Also when you die you loose all your weapons except the defaults and dont get as much money in the end of the round but it makes it more challenging this way. Over all Killing floor is a great game but still isnt perfect well if there is ever a steam sale And this is at a low price its worth it welll there you have it.

Killing Floor is one of those games that isn't terribly amazing but it sure is fun. The waves and waves of gruesome and horrid enemies coupled with the gore that emits from the ememies as you blow them to bits with your shotgun is just extremely fun. I would definitely recommend this game, but only if it goes on sale. It's such a fun game if you are into waves and gore and crazy enemies.

Prepare for one of the most awesome zombie games.

Really fun game to play. I mean, what is there that is better than decapitating zombie-like monsters with a crappy pistol that lasts you all the way until the End-of-Match boss?

Nothing. That's what.

The game is great. With pubs being able to work effectively in a team without even communicating and just sensing when someone is in trouble. I mean, of course you need to give them a hint every now and then, but most of the time it's like Spidey Sense. They just know. And so do you. Like magic...

Combat is fun but can get repetetive after a while and because of that I might recommend some people to take breaks from this game. After all it is just shooting things, blowing things up and slicing things. It can get boring after a little while, but not so boring that it would make you want to get a refund.

The game runs pretty well on an Nvidia GTX 560ti which is pretty outdated (but heck, I can run The Witcher 3 on high setting with this) but it can run well on max settings due to the game also being outdated.

Community is great with a massive variety of custom maps and mods for those maps that offer a large variety of gameplay. People often play on those servers but quite a few also play on standard ones too as loading into the custom servers can take a big chunk of time due to all of the custom textures and files and stuff.

[b]TL;DR[/b] Overall, this game is great for friends and strangers alike, although I think more people have flocked over to KF2, [b]however[/b], there are still a lot of people playing this game for it's nostalgiac things.

Give it a play. It's great fun.

play killing floor :]

[h1]Review Update 2021/2022[/h1]
Killing Floor is a hidden gem, a masterpiece of coop zombie shooters, covered beneath newcomer-unfriendly mechanics, nonsense logic, weird design choices, and broken hitboxes. In the beginning, the game makes everything to alienate new players (a.k.a. Fresh Meat), so only the chosen ones stay. But once you fall in love with the game, the bond lasts forever. I'm playing KF1 for 12 years, 4000 gameplay hours, and the game still rocks. During these years, I tried many different coop games or/and zombie shooters, and none of them were as good as this time-proven title, even its sequel.

[h1]Hard to Learn, Easy to Master[/h1]
Nope, you didn't misread, as I didn't mistype. KF1 is an upside-down of common practice. It is super unfriendly to newcomers. I came to KF from Left 4 Dead, having 15 years of experience in FPS gaming. It took me [b]3 attempts[/b] to get familiar and start enjoying the game. I rage-quit for the first two tries, even left a negative review. Don't even try a difficulty harder than Normal until you learn the roots. Even on Normal difficulty, your very first experience will be like this: get trapped by Clots, puked over by a Bloat => gg.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/1250/discussions/0/2592234299538128315/]Reading this guide helps beginners a lot.[/url]

However, once you've learned the basics, it is quite easy to become a good player and a valid team member even on the hardest difficulty (Hell on Earth). Most likely, you will be spending hundreds or even thousands of hours simply because you enjoy playing the game rather than mastering superior skills. Because this is a coop game where teamwork plays a major role, and no need for heroes when everybody is doing their job. However, becoming a "hero" is also an option if you don't want to rely on your team but solely survive the outbreak of the specimen (a.k.a. zeds or zombies).

[h1]Fantastic Gunplay[/h1]
While it may seem outdated in 2021, gunplay in Killing Floor is still perfect. Gunplay is the reason I kept returning to KF1 after rage-quitting. Popping heads with Handcannon (a.k.a. Desert Eagle) never gets old. Same as unleashing the Boomstick double-shot at the point-blank and seeing zeds tearing apart and flying ten meters away. Pistols, Assault Rifles, Shotguns, Sniper Rifles, Grenade/Rocket Launchers, Flamethrowers, etc. - KF1 has a wide arsenal to choose from. Most weapons feel solid and quite realistic, especially for an arcade shooter.
Those who say that Back 4 Blood has decent gunplay have never played Killing Floor. B4B's guns feel like plastic toys in comparison to KF.

[h1]Teamwork: Encouraged but Optional[/h1]
Playing as a team where everybody does their job according to the chosen role (perk) is much easier than surviving alone. However, teamwork is not mandatory. There are no arbitrary limitations that force you to play as a team, e.g., getting incapacitated and requiring a teammate's help, where the latter usually is nothing but QTE. There is no such thing in KF. You stick with the team because you [i]want to[/i], not because you [i]have to[/i]. Surviving in society is easier and safer, like in real life. However, you can play "Rambo" if you have the skills and "balls" to do so. Or if your teammates suck. Or if you are alone.

Optional teamwork has yet another upside - no need to fill the team with bots or randoms. You can play solo or play with a friend - just two of you. Unlike L4D and its clones, KF scales perfectly for a different number of players. Moreover, a different player count may offer various play styles. Playing solo is not the same as playing with a friend, which, in turn, is different from playing in a 6-player team.

[h1]Extreme Replayability[/h1]
While Back 4 Blood uses this term for marketing purposes to cover the lack of content in such an overpriced game, Killing Floor truly offers extreme replayability.
[list]
[*] 36 official maps + Workshop support, where you can find at least a few dozens of good-quality community-made maps.
[*] Seven official perks with more than fifty weapons. Each perk and weapon loadout offers a different, unique playstyle.
[*] Full modding support offers custom perks, weapons, enemies, etc. There are mods and modded servers with more than ten perks and hundreds of weapons.
[*] At the moment of writing, I have 4000 gameplay hours in KF1 and still didn't get bored. And I'm not the only one - there are thousands of KF players having thousands of gameplay hours each.
[/list]

[h1]Getting Started[/h1]
If you are still reading this text, it means that you've passed the general requirement to start playing KF - the ability to read and process information longer than a tweet. Let's get started then.
[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/1250/discussions/0/2592234299538128315/]Read this guide[/url] first. It explains weird KF mechanics and design choices that might frustrate new players in the beginning. I wish I had that guide back when I started playing...
[*] In the beginning, I encourage you to skip the vanilla game and jump straight to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ScrNBalance/discussions/2/483368526570475472/]ScrN Brutal KF Bundle[/url] mod. The mod offers tons of bug fixes, balance adjustments, QoL improvements and modernizes the game to fit more in 2021. The most important - it keeps [i]the core gameplay close to vanilla[/i]. The experience (skills) you get while playing the mod is also valid for the vanilla game - if you decide to earn Steam achievements, for example.
[/list]

[h1]Solid Community; Time-Proven Game[/h1]
KF1 has a small but solid and consistent community. There are 300-500 concurrent KF1 players every day on Steam. There is no problem finding a server to play on, especially in Europe or North America. Moreover, teammates are not a must-have since the game can be played solo too. If you have a friend to play with, it is enough to enjoy the beauty of KF teamwork.
If you enjoy playing on crowded servers, I suggest joining some KF communities to organize/schedule games. Here are some examples:
[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ScrNBalance]ScrN Balance Fans[/url]
[*] [url=https://discord.gg/Y3W5crSXA5]Scrake Naders[/url]
[*] [url=https://discord.com/invite/wzNxus5K]Exiled Coalition[/url]
[/list]

Killing Floor è una delle migliori esperienze cooperative disponibili sul mercato. Unisciti ad una compagnia di altre 5 persone, e massacra ondate di zombie sempre più potenti, utilizzando un armamentario vastissimo, pieno di armi convenzionali e non. Uno sparatutto adrenalinico che difficilmente vi stancherà.
Игра очень прикольная)Похожа на L4D2.

Плюсы: играть интересно; временами очень зрелищно; оружие красивое; бензопила.
Минусы: скучная система развития персонажей; всего 6 карт в комплекте.
